intro: Conyza monticola, commonly known as mountain ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Conyza monticola is often found in sandy or loamy soils and is adapted to full sun exposure.
